Text.Value: *The laugh-urge fades. A quiet power spreads from hand to head, then down to your feet.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: Hee hee. Thou must endure!
Ha. Haha. Ha ha ha HA HA HA HAAAAAA!
I've found Wyrm's Crossing. Where is your granddaughter?

EditorData.logicalname: Said where to take it - now in WYR

Text.Value: Ha! Can thou endure?
What is happening? What are you doing to me?
Focus on this entity. What are its intentions?
Close your eyes and let your magic flow through you in all its wild and beautiful glory.
Oh ho ho HO NO NO!
Discard the amulet.
To my granddaughter. Shirra Clarwen. Serves Ilmater, she doth.
*Whatever madness this spirit suffers was inflicted by Lathander's enemies - followers of Shar. And this madness may flow into you.*
Quiet your mind. Let everything be still.
*You stifle a chuckle and drop the amulet. The urge to laugh passes...*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Drop the Amulet, followed by short chuckle <ChrisW>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player stifles their laughter and drops the amulet. The spirit disappears.

Text.Value: Stow the amulet.
*Flying machines. Walking brains. It's all so absurd!*
Do not abandon my blessing - hee hee!
Are you a ghost? What happened to you?
Endure!
*You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: *The urge to laugh intensifies. Talking jewellery? That's hilarious!*
The Sharrans tormented me. And I laughed at the pain 'til ne'er couldst I stop.
*You observe the urge to laugh from afar, letting it fade with each breath.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: Keep the amulet equipped.
Sharrans broke my body. But my spirit, they could not. Well - not completely. Hee HEE!
*The urge flows into the strands of the Weave, leaving only a sense of calm.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Take out the weave and the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: That thing's tainted. Better to leave it than bear a dead man's grudges.
*Images of illithids torturing and tormenting your people quells the urge to laugh - for now.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: *Your power spikes, banishing the urge to laugh in an instant.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: Drop the amulet.
*Sheer, unbridled rage floods your veins, obliterating the urge to laugh.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: *Beneath the rampant joy, you sense the monk's fear and sincerity. He doesn't wish to harm you - but that doesn't mean he won't.*
*Lines and arcs are etched into the metal, but you see no pattern in them.*
I could barely hold my laughter. What did you do to me?
Call on the power of your pact and resist the urge.
O! Thou shalt be blessed indeed. He he hee!
I will take you to your granddaughter at Wyrm's Crossing.
Thou shalt return me, ho HO. Thou shalt have my blessing.

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* [Player] HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_HoldInventory_Close_01 <ChrisW>

Text.Value: Reach for the Weave. Let it shield you from this impulse.
Done, it shalt be! Ho HO!
*You feel a chuckle coming on - but it soon fades.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Slight chuckle, stow the amulet <ChrisW>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Spirit fades away, player pockets amulet.

Text.Value: Consider the inscribed image. What could it mean?
Fight the urge.
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.
Equip the amulet.
How unfortunate. Alas, thou must do. Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee!
Give in to the laughter.
Kill the mirth. RESIST.
Is there affliction more terrible than eternal joy? This is my pleasure. This is my curse.
Summon your light and devotion as you push back.
Ha. Ha ha. Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha hee!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Uncontrollable laughter, almost painful, before fading away <ChrisW>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player breaks out in uncontrollable laughter as Tasha's Hideous Laughter is cast on them. Eventually, it dissipates, leaving the player briefly clutching their stomach in pain before returning to their default state.
EditorData.NodeContext: Uncontrollable laughter, on the brink of madness.

Text.Value: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Holding amulet, surprised reaction/wince leading to confusion at trying to surpress laughter <ChrisW>

Text.Value: *Etched on its face is an image of the dawning sun.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* [Player] HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_HoldInventory_Close_01 <ChrisW>

Text.Value: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*
Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* [Player] HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_HoldInventory_Close_01 <ChrisW>

Text.Value: *The image is striking, but you find no meaning in it.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* [Player] HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_HoldInventory_Close_01 <ChrisW>

Text.Value: A ghost? Ha HA! I am sunlight on water, dew on grass.
Examine the amulet.
I'm afraid your granddaughter has passed away.
*Laughter builds, deep in your chest. It is... irresistible.*
Squash all cheer and summon memories of your ancestral enemy - the mind flayers.
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
That laughter. What did you do to me?
Thou shalt return me home. It is written!
Ha ha, hast thou missed me? Take me to my dear Shirra and open her tomb!
I shall walk with thee. I shall grant you my power. He HEE.
*You recognise the symbol: it belongs to those sworn to Lathander, god of dawn and renewal.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* [Player] HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_HoldInventory_Close_01 <ChrisW>

Text.Value: Return you where? To whom?
Shirra hath devoted her body and soul to Ilmater. Find her at the Open Hand Temple!
Whisper a prayer. Quell the feeling with your devotion.
Prithee, now is not the time for dreaming! Open thine eyes, fair fool!
She waits in Wyrm's Crossing. Take me there, and thou shalt bathe in her golden gifts.
*There is no escaping the laughter. Telepathic mushrooms? Walking brains? It's all so comical!*
This cannot, must not, shall not be - he HEE. You must open her tomb in the Open Hand Temple, posthaste. She may bless us, even beyond the veil!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!
*Your faith and dedication surrounds you, forming an impenetrable shield.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Text.Value: You mustn't! Hee hee HEE.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Drop the Amulet <ChrisW>

Text.Value: Ha. Thou hast come again!

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* [Player] HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_HoldInventory_Close_01 <ChrisW>

Text.Value: *Your pure, raw power rips through the urge to laugh.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Player] Closing eyes and concentrating, the laughter dissipates <ChrisW>

Synopsis: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).
